Interface BinaryOperator<D,R>

All Known Implementing Classes:
BinaryExpression.Operator, BinaryFormula.Operator, BinaryIntExpression.Operator, ComparisonFormula.Operator, IntComparisonFormula.Operator
public interface BinaryOperator<D,R>

Defines a generic interface for a binary operator.

Author:
Emina Torlak
specfield:
op: (D -> D) ->lone R

Method Summary
 R apply(D left, D right)
          Returns the result of applying this operator to the given left and right arguments.
 boolean associative()
          Returns true if this binary operator is associative.
 boolean commutative()
          Returns true if this binary operator is commutative.
 

Method Detail

commutative

boolean commutative()
Returns true if this binary operator is commutative.

Returns:
all d1, d2: D | this.op[d1,d2] = this.op[d2,d1]

associative

boolean associative()
Returns true if this binary operator is associative.

Returns:
all d1, d2, d3: D | this.op[d1, this.op[d2, d3]] = this.op[this.op[d1,d2], d3]

apply

R apply(D left,
        D right)
Returns the result of applying this operator to the given left and right arguments.

Returns:
this.op[left, right]
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - this operator is not applicable to the given arguments
